title: Bank of England split 7-2 over interest rate rise - business live | Business | The Guardian
summary: ons : uk real wages fell again in 2014
mpc split over risks to uk economy .
pub shares slide after tied pub vote .

documents.title: mixed day for markets
text: european markets saw most of their early gains wiped out ahead of the latest us federal reserve minutes , with mining shares coming under pressure as iron ore prices fell on concerns about the chinese economy .
in the end it was a mixed performance , with the uk market hit by a number of disappointing updates , notably the royal mail .

the final scores showed : the ftse 100 finished down 12.53 points or 0.19 % at 6696.60 germany 's dax edged up 0.17 % at 9472.80 france 's cac closed up 0.09 % at 4266.19 italy 's ftse mib added 0.14 % to 19,379.92 but spain 's ibex ended down 0.54 % at 10,376.8 on wall street , the dow jones industrial average has pulled back from tuesday 's record highs , slipping 21 points or 0.12 % .
and on that note , it 's time to close up for the evening .
thanks for all your comments , and we 'll be back tomorrow .
over to greece , where officials are saying they are working overtime to unlock stalled relations with the country 's troika of creditors .

our correspondent helena smith writes : senior greek officials say they have passed on by email a final set of proposals '' outlining the measures the government is willing to take to plug a fiscal hole in its 2015 budget .
we are expecting an answer by tomorrow at the latest , '' said one insider speaking on condition of anonymity .
antonis samaras .
photo : yiannis kourtoglou/afp/getty images the greek prime minister antonis samaras is also believed to have hit the phones in a bid to break the impasse .
he may start visiting eu capitals , aides say , to convey the government 's fear of the political cost '' further cost-cutting measures would have .

digging in their heels , mission chiefs representing the eu , imf and ecb have reportedly stepped up demands , saying they will only return at staff level '' to the greek capital once it is clear the ruling coalition is willing to implement reforms .

hopes of a solution being found in time for auditors to complete their review of the economy by december 8 when euro area finance ministers hold their last euro group meeting of the year , are fading fast .
well-briefed sources say the troika has toughened its stance precisely because of the political instability speculation of early elections has sparked in greece .

some suggest that the turmoil may well continue into the new year , dashing hopes of athens launching talks on a precautionary credit line , '' the centerpiece of a follow-up program that would replace the financial adjustment , or bailout , accord that has governed greece 's relations with creditors since the debt-stricken country sought international emergency funding .
alexis tsipras .

photo : pablo blazquez dominguez/getty images amid growing calls for feuding politicians to break the gridlock , the radical left main opposition syriza party announced that its leader , antonis tsipras , would be willing to meet samaras ( the two men have had almost no contact over the past year ) but highlighting the degree to which consensus is missing from greece 's fractious political arena , stipulated that such talks could not take place if evangelos venizelos , the deputy premier , was present .
we think that [ the presence of ] venizelos would be unnecessary , '' said panos skourletis the party 's spokesman insisting that samaras , alone , should be able to convey the government 's views .
the finance ministry will present next year 's budget to the greek parliament on friday , it announced .

and after some confusion about the figures , there does indeed seem to be a swiss poll ahead of this month 's gold referendum : ransquawk ( @ ransquawk ) to confirm 38 % would vote yes , 47 % would vote no and 15 % undecided # gold forex.com ( @ forexcom ) indeed the up move in # eurchf & selling in # gold was due to a poll from srg showing support slipping in swiss gold referendum 38 % vs 47 % ^fr holger zschaepitz ( @ schuldensuehner ) gold drops on reports that swiss favor 'no ' vote in referendum .
poll shows 38 % of voters back initiative , 47 % against
gold is falling sharply on various rumours going round the markets , including supposed hawkish comments in the forthcoming federal reserve minutes .
there was also talk that a new poll would show a majority against new gold reserve limits in the forthcoming swiss referendum ( on november 30 ) .
a yes vote would be expected to boost gold prices , said analysts , so a negative outcome would be likely to send the precious metal in the opposite direction .
igsquawk ( @ igsquawk ) $ gold is falling as poll for swiss gold referendum suggests less than 40 % will say yes to new gold reserve limits .
ab

and reuters now has a more detailed report on dr shafik 's appearance at the treasury committee : the bank of england 's regulatory arm will scrutinise bonuses awarded to traders involved in attempts to manipulate the currency market , a top official said on wednesday .

boe deputy governor minouche shafik said some of the banks fined last week for attempting to manipulate the foreign exchange market were already clawing back bonus awards for traders that were involved .
the boe 's prudential regulation authority supervises banks in britain .
i would certainly say that we will look at their remuneration proposals when we get them in january , '' she told parliament 's treasury committee .

these are clearly egregious cases of misconduct and one would hope to see remuneration committees in these firms will use these powers they have to hold these individuals to account , '' shafik added .
some banks have dipped into bonus pools to pay recent fines , which sends a very strong signal , she added .
the treasury committee .

here 's some early reuters snaps from dr shafik 's comments at the select committee : 19-nov-2014 15:18 - bank of england 's shafik says we would expect banks to use powers to claw back bonuses from individuals in alleged forex rigging 19-nov-2014 15:20 - bank of england 's shafik says do n't attach much credibility to view firms could leave uk because of misconduct penalities 19-nov-2014 15:25 - boe 's shafik says agree in principle that even junior workers could come under bonus deferral rules , tougher in practice
nemat ( minouche ) shafik , deputy governor of the bank of england since august , is up before the treasury select committee , talking about the foreign exchange markets .
link to the live stream is here .
deputy governor of the bank of england nemat ( minouche ) shafik
us markets have opened and ahead of the lastest federal reserve minutes , due to be released later , they have got off to a downbeat start .
after tuesday 's new record - yes , yet another one - the dow jones industrial average is down 41 points or 0.23 % in early trading .
mixed signals from the us housing market .
after tuesday 's report showing housebuilders were increasingly confident about the outlook , comes news that housing starts fell unexpectedly in october .
they dropped 2.8 % to a annual rate of 1.009m houses compared to expectations of a 1.025m rate .
but it was the multi-family home segment , which tends to be more volatile , which accounted for the decline .
starts for single-family homes , the largest part of the market , rose to their highest level in a year .

documents.title: lunchtime summary
text: a quick lunchtime recap .
royal mail shares have been savaged this morning after the postal operator reported a 21 % drop in operating profits , and warned that amazon taking chunks out of the parcel market .
they are currently down 7.5 % at 433p .
analysts warn that christmas will be absolutely crucial for the company , floated 13 months ago .
new data from the office for national statistics show that britons suffered another year of falling real wages , with little progress in closing the gender pay gap .

the bank of england remains split over interest rates ; the minutes of its last meeting show that two policymakers voted to raise rates , while the seven who voted for 'no change ' are divided over the risks to the economy .
and investors in pub companies are nursing a nasty hangover after mps voted to loosen the rules that tie landlords into buying beer from the companies who own their pub .
shares in pub companies have been pummelled .
denise roland ( @ deniseroland ) so , what is or was the 'beer tie ' ?
via telegraph
the news that average real wages shrank by another 1.6 % in the 12 months to april has been seized , with gusto , by the opposition labour party .
ed balls , shadow chancellor , says it undermines the government 's argument that the economy has been fixed .
working people are worse off under david cameron 's government and millions face a further hit if the tories win the election .
david cameron and george osborne have promised to cut tax credits again while keeping a £ 3 billion a year tax cut for the top one per cent of earners .
we need a recovery for the many , not just a few at the top .
labour 's economic plan will tackle the cost-of-living crisis and earn our way to higher living standards for all .
our plan will raise the minimum wage , boost apprenticeships , get 200,000 new homes built a year and expand free childcare for working parents .
and we will balance the books in the next parliament , but do so in a fairer way - starting by reversing david cameron 's tax cut for millionaires . ''
on the other hand , the figures do show that the majority of employees who have remained in the same job for at least one year did better than average .

their pay rose by 2.4 % once you adjust for inflation although if you 're a government minister , you might prefer to ignore inflation : george osborne ( @ george osborne ) ons data shows pay rising 4.1 % for those in a job for more than a year , further evidence # longtermeconomicplan working but more to do
the bank of england minutes are a little more hawkish than expected , says martin beck , senior economic advisor to the ey item club .
he points to the line about a material spread of views '' among mpc members about inflationary risks but still does n't think rates will rise for several months .
despite the widening of viewpoints among the mpc 's doves , we think that the majority in favour of keeping rates on hold wo n't be disappearing anytime soon .
as a result , a rate rise wo n't happen until well into 2015 .

with the mpc forecasting that cpi inflation will drop below 1 % in the next few months and remain below the 2 % target for the next three years , it begs the question why the mpc is n't taking action to loosen policy now . ''
the average full time male worker earned 9.4 % more than their female counterpart , according to today 's data .
that shows that more needs to be done to close britain 's gender pay gap , says tuc general secretary frances o'grady : it 's good to see the gender pay gap narrowing again .
but after last year 's widening we 're only back to where we were in 2012 .
part-time women 's pay still lags some way behind that of their full-time colleagues .
nearly six million women work part-time and they earn £ 5.15 less per hour than full-time men .
two in five of part-time women earn less than the living wage .
we need better paid , flexible , part-time work opportunities , and better paid leave for fathers to encourage more equal parenting .
the full-time gender pay gap may have closed for younger women but it widens dramatically for women in their 40s and 50s .

far too many women still find they have to take a step down to access flexible or reduced hours once they become mothers , and their earnings never recover even when they return to full-time work . ''

documents.title: ons : uk real wages fell again in 2014
text: here 's some sobering news - uk real wages have fallen for the sixth year running .
new figures from the office for national statistics today show the full scale of the squeeze on living standards , as earnings have stagnated in the face of economic 'recovery ' .
real pay , adjusted for inflation , fell by 1.6 % this year , with gross weekly earnings barely growing at all .

my colleague angela monaghan has analysed the data , and reports : the figures laid bare the financial pressures that continue to weigh on uk households , despite falling unemployment and economic recovery which has put the economy on course to grow by about 3 % this year .
policymakers at the bank of england have persistently cited unexpectedly weak wage growth as one of the reasons why interest rates remain at an all-time low of 0.5 % , unchanged since march 2009 .

and there 's been hardly any progress in closing the gender pay gap : full story here : uk workers hit by sixth year of falling real pay alberto nardelli ( @ albertonardelli ) britain 's low pay recovery - wages are back on levels last seen in the early 2000s

documents.title: royal mail shares now down 9 %
text: shares in royal mail have now slumped by around 9 % , as the city digests this morning 's results .
the postal operator is the biggest faller on the ftse 100 today , down 43.7p to 425.3p .

the company will have been briefing analysts this morning , after reporting a 21 % drop in profits and saying amazon is eating into the parcels business ( as covered earlier ) brenda kelly of ig index says that investors have noted royal mail 's warning that amazon 's competitive delivery network means the parcels market will only grow half as fast as expected .
we can expect more of the same from royal mail , while the expectation of hitting targets for the full-year hinges on a good christmas and thus the risk of disappointment is high .
analysts at jeffries are also concerned .
the outlook for the parcel market is worse than expected , with expected volume growth of only 1 % -2 % for around 2 years , which implies parcel revenues would remain stable at best .
this effect would be somewhat mitigated by higher than expected cost savings , but on balance we think the outlook has further deteriorated .
worth remembering that business secretary vince cable warned several times that there was 'froth ' on royal mail 's share price , after it spiked after privatisation .
oliver rivers ( @ maxrothbarth ) just conceivable cable was not wrong about royal mail share price not much comfort for shareholders who have held onto their stakes .
shane croucher ( @ shanecroucher ) royal mail shares tanking .
down over 8 % after crap results .
they 'd better hope santa 's tendering for his parcels deliveries this christmas .

documents.title: pound rallies after bank minutes
text: pound vs us dollar this morning .
reuters the pound has risen almost half a cent against the us dollar since the bank minutes came out , to $ 1.567 .
this suggesting that some traders had expected an 8-1 or 9-0 vote on interest rates , with weale or mccafferty , or both , dropping their call for rate rises .
nicholas ebisch , currency analyst for caxton fx , says : the inflation report cited the risks to the uk economy and that supporting inflation is still the top priority .
the market may have priced more mpc members voting against an interest rate rise this morning , but the unchanged vote figures bode well for sterling .

today 's minutes reinforce expectations that uk interest rates wo n't rise until the back end of next year , reckons jake trask , corporate dealer at ukforex : seven mpc members saw concerns over low inflation , sluggish wage growth and falling exports due to a stagnating eurozone economy - obstacles that need to be negotiated before they would consider a rate rise .

it now seems likely that the earliest we can expect a hike is late 2015 , though some are not forecasting an increase until 2016 , especially if the situation in the eurozone deteriorates further . ''
reaction to the bank of england minutes is coming in .

jeremy cook , chief economist of world first , is n't convinced by the argument from the bank 's two hawks that wages will start to rise as 'slack ' is mopped up we hope this is true but we have heard this line from policymakers before and yet , have seen very little upwards pressure on wages in recent months . ''

my colleague nick fletcher explains why uk pub shares are being hammered today : pub company shares are heading into the slops tray after mps voted to give tenants more freedom over buying their beer .
overturning government plans for industry reforms , mps unexpectedly gave the go-ahead to an amendment to allow tenants to buy beer on the open market .

around half of britain 's 50,000 pubs are run by tenants under the beer-tie which mean they buy beer from the company which holds the pub lease - this is often at higher prices than the market rate in return for subsidised rent full story : pub shares slump after mps vote to give tenants free choice of beer and a hat-tip and a bag of pork scratchings to fastft for this chart , showing the scale of the rout : robin wigglesworth ( @ robinwigg ) uk pub shares going down faster than a tequila slammer after parliamentary vote ht @ twitterid

documents.title: mpc split over risks to uk economy
text: the boe minutes also show that there was a material spread of views on the balance of risks to the outlook '' among the seven members of the mpc who voted to keep rates at 0.5 % .
some mpc members sound rather dovish , concerned that uk growth will fall faster than expected .

in that case a premature tightening in policy would leave the economy vulnerable to shocks , with the scope for any stimulus that subsequently became necessary being limited by the effective lower bound on interest rates .
others , though , are more hawkish ; reckoning that the spare capacity in the economy could be used up faster than expected .
that would potentially result in inflation rising to , and subsequently overshooting , the 2 % target .
individual members ascribed materially different probabilities to these risks .
in other words , the mpc ca n't really agree about what 's happening in the uk economy
jasper lawler ( @ jlawler cmc ) mccafferty and weale still think lower inflation largely the effect of the higher exchange rate and lower raw material prices # boe
the minutes show that martin weale and ian mccafferty argued , in vain , that the mpc should ignore the fact uk inflation had fallen to a five-year low in september .
after all , the committee resisted hiking rates when rising oil prices drove inflation up a few years ago , so it should resist keeping them low now .
the minute say : for two members , economic circumstances continued to justify an immediate rise in bank rate .
while cpi inflation was well below the target , this was largely the effect of the higher exchange rate and lower raw material prices .

just as the committee had looked through the first-round effect of external price pressures when they had pushed inflation up , it was appropriate to look through them at present when they were pushing inflation down .
the bank of england minutes are online here .

documents.title: bank of england minutes released
text: the bank of england 's monetary policy committee voted 7-2 on whether to leave interest rates unchanged this month , according to the minutes of the meeting ( which took place a fortnight ago ) .
they show that martin weale and ian mccafferty voted , again , to raise borrowing costs to 0.75 % .
they argued that wage growth could up sharply in the months ahead , as the labour market tightens .
their seven colleagues , though , voted to leave them at their current record low of 0.5 % .
more to follow

documents.title: read the news story here
text: and here 's our news story on royal mail 's results : julia kollewe ( @ juliakollewe ) royal mail warns amazon delivery service will hit uk parcels business
you can see royal mail 's results here .
royal mail news ( @ royalmailnews ) we have announced our half year results :
royal mail had hoped that growth in parcel deliveries would cover the decline in its letters business , as more people order items online .

but as michael hewson of cmc markets explains , it 's an increasingly tough market : the explosion in on-line retailing , click and collect delivery and the use of mobile apps this year is likely to see fierce competition between logistics providers with uk mail , ups and fedex likely to provide plenty of competition , while the recent tie-up between amazon and connect group to provide a 24 hour service for parcel delivery to selected local locations , like underground stations , newsagents and shopping centres , could make a significant dent in royal mail 's revenue particularly since amazon is royal mail 's largest parcel customer .
this will inevitably place greater focus on parcelforce 's volumes , as more and more people choose to up their parcel at a location more convenient to their day to day needs .

city firm panmure gordon reckons that royal mail is performing broadly in line with expectations , but faces a struggle to grow : with limited revenue growth potential in the near term , it 's down on-going cost control to improve earnings .

documents.title: pub shares slide after tied pub vote
text: shares in several british pub chains have slumped faster than a well-watered regular at last orders , after mps voted to loosen the controls on tied landlords .
the vote was an embarrassing defeat for the government .
it will mean that around 15,000 tied landlords will be able to buy beer on the open market rather than stuck with one company .
they 'll also be able to have their rent independently assessed .
shares in britain 's biggest pub landlord , enterprise inns , have crashed by 13 % as i type , and other companies are also hurting .
katie martin ( @ katie martin fx ) pubs getting hammered ( hic ) after the beer tie vote .

enterprise inns -7.7 % ; greene king - 5 % ; punch taverns -7 % campaigners believe that breaking these ties will help pubs stay in business , but the industry has argued that it will lead to more pubs closing .
after that early rally , royal mail shares are now down 1 % at 463p as investors digest its warning that the parcels business is challenging .
a postman carrying mail bags .
rousseau/pa royal mail 's results are fairly unimpressive , reckons richard hunter , head of equities at hargreaves lansdown stockbrokers .
here 's his take : having completed its first full year as a listed company , royal mail is now facing the harsh realities with the initial share price euphoria having waned .
most of the key metrics are flat to negative , with a decrease in operating profit , margin and earnings per share accompanied by an increase in costs .

the quiet emergence of amazon in the parcels space , already a fiercely competitive arena , could become a medium term threat , whilst the company openly concedes in its outlook that the christmas period will set the tone for the full year performance .

more positively , the european parcels business performed well once more , the decline in letters was less than expected in the period ( although it remains an area of terminal decline ) , whilst the projected dividend yield of 4.4 % is supportive in the current interest rate environment .
this chart shows how royal mail shares had rallied in the last couple of months , having fallen back during spring and summer to as low as 390p .

royal mail share price reuters however , it does n't show that shares were actually sold at 330p , so anyone who took part in the float has profited ( including the city firms who got preferential treatment in the ipo , and sold shortly afterwards ) .
steve hawkes ( @ steve hawkes ) fancy that .
royal mail - now a plc - says universal service ( 6 day delivery anywhere for same price ) is under serious threat .
royal mail shares have risen by 1.3 % at the start of trading in london , gaining 6.1p to 475p .
today 's results are a little better than expected ( analysts had predicted that operating profits would fall by 30 % in the six months to 30 september , not the 21 % reported ) .
at 475p , royal mail shares are still around 43 % above the 330p at which they were sold in october 2013 .
at their peak , in early 2014 , they were trading at over £ 6 .
today 's results include a plea to the government and regulators to rewrite royal mail 's universal service obligations .
we think there is an urgent need for a new framework that will secure the sustainable provision of the universal service for the future .
currently , royal mail is obliged to deliver to every home in the uk from monday to saturday , for a fixed price ( more details here ) .
new entrants to the market do n't have this restriction - giving them ( it claims ) a structural cost advantage '' and the ability to cherry- the services they offer '' .
royal mail is governed by the uso until 2021 ; mps from rural constituencies have already voiced concerns that the company might try to get it watered down once it were privatised
the 1 % increase in letter revenues was mainly due to election mailings '' , royal mail says ( such as the may 's european elections and local council ballots ) .
that could be a profitable area for the company next year too , with a general election due in may . )
kamal ahmed ( @ bbckamal ) profits down 6 % at royal mail from £ 233m to £ 218m as amazon eats into parcels market .
lot of election campaigning means letter revenues up

documents.title: royal mail : amazon will eat into parcels business
text: royal mail has also halved its forecast for growth in its parcels division , as web giant amazon continues to eat into the sector .
it says : we estimate amazon 's own delivery network will reduce the annual rate of growth in the uk addressable market to 1-2 % for approximately two years .
ismail mulla ( @ ismailmulla ) royal mail halves expected growth rates of its uk parcels market as first-half operating profits fall by 21 % .
last month , amazon launched a same-day delivery service which allowed customers to up items at local newsagents and high street shops , through a tie-up with distribution group smiths news .
if that service takes off , it is likely to bleed business away from parcel delivery firms .
royal mail had already suffered from amazon 's decision to scrap free super-saver '' delivery on items worth less than £ 10 .

documents.title: royal mail profits fall in 'challenging ' parcels market
text: lloyd/getty images royal mail has warned that the uk parcels market is a tough and highly competitive '' place to operate , after reporting that profits have fallen .
the firm , privatised 13 months ago , just reported that pre-tax profits , stripping out one-off items , fell by 6 % in the six months to 29 september 2014 , from £ 233m to £ 218m .
revenues from parcels fell by 1 % during the half-year , it warned , wiping out some of the benefits of a 1 % rise in revenues from delivering letters . : .
mail and on an operating level , profits are down by over 20 % to £ 279m , from £ 353m a year earlier .
moya greene , ceo , says she is pleased '' with the overall performance , with royal mail keeping tight cost control '' .
but the uk parcels market remains challenging .
as the pre-eminent uk parcels delivery company , we are targeting a number of new , growing areas , and delivered two per cent volume growth in a competitive market .
we had a better than expected performance in uk letters .
gls , our european parcels business , demonstrated a strong performance with better than expected volumes in domestic and export parcels .
our performance remains in line with our expectations for the full year .
but , as always , this depends on us delivering another great christmas , for which we are fully prepared . ''
more details and reaction to follow

documents.title: the agenda : royal mail , bank of england minutes coming up
text: good morning , and welcome to our rolling coverage of the financial markets , the economy , business and the eurozone .
coming up today royal mail is releasing its financial results for the first half of the year ; full coverage of that from 7am gmt .
the bank of england releases the minutes of this month 's monetary policy committee meeting , at 9.30am .
that will show whether the committee was still split 7-2 on whether to leave interest rates unchanged .
boe deputy governor minouche shafik is testifying to parliament 's treasury committee this afternoon ( 2.45pm ) , on the bank 's fair and efficient markets review .
that 's its bid to raise standards across the city and put an end to the stream of scandals .
speaking of central banks overnight , the bank of japan has repeated its commitment to a more aggressive stimulus plan .
eight out of nine boj policymakers backed the plan to expand the country 's money supply , in the light of the country 's latest recession .
last month it was only five james bevan ( @ jamesbevan ccla ) the boj policy board 's voted 8:1 to expand the monetary base at an annualised ¥80tn vs. the 5:4 decision for more easing last month .
and we 'll be watching greece , where the government and its lenders are ( again ) struggling to reach agreement on whether it has met the terms of its bailout ( as covered in yesterday 's blog )

bulletin.text: Royal Mail shares dive 8% on parcel fears.
Bank of England MPC minutes released.
